{3_PlayerName} receives a Unique Event for {1_CivShortDescription}.
{3_PlayerName} captures a Great Person in a raid!
{3_PlayerName} receives a Unique Event for {1_CivShortDescription}.
{3_PlayerName} opens a Silk Road to trade his exotic [ICON_RES_SILK] Silk far afield.
{3_PlayerName} receives a Unique Event for {1_CivShortDescription}.
{3_PlayerName} promises to give back to the peoples whose lands he has ravished!
{3_PlayerName} receives a Unique Event for {1_CivShortDescription}.
{3_PlayerName} opens a trade route of extreme length in order to introduce a new type of [ICON_RES_TEA] Tea.
{3_PlayerName} receives a Unique Event for {1_CivShortDescription}.
{3_PlayerName} shows respect to the holy men of his Empire!
{3_PlayerName} receives a Unique Event for {1_CivShortDescription}.
{3_PlayerName} begins large-scale excavation of previously exhausted mining sites!
They Call Him Timujin
Khan, the latest round of capitves is ready to kneel before you and beg for their lives.[NEWLINE]Would you like a cushion? This could go on for some time.
Receive a Great Person of your choice.
Spend {1_YieldCost} to develop a great Silk Road. The production of 3 copies of [ICON_RES_SILK] is now possible, and [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes with your Cities generate +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for both you and the sender.
Declare laws to protect the poor and holy, wronged by our conquests. Courthouses give out -3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and -1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. In return, your mercifulness reduces [ICON_GOLD] Poverty thresholds by 10%, and reduces [ICON_RELIGION] Religious Divisions by 20%.
Send out Caravans to establish a Tea Road across the expanse. The production of 2 copies of [ICON_RES_TEA] is now possible, and [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes over land travel 50% further and generate +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Honour our holy men with {1_YieldCost}. A Monastery is erected in every City, and all Monasteries generate an additional +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Massively increase funding for mining in the Empire by {1_YieldCost}. Mines generate +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. You receive 3 copies of: [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron, [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal, [ICON_RES_ALUMINUM] Aluminium, and [ICON_RES_URANIUM] Uranium.
In all these audiences we have yet to come across a single man of merit. These men accomplished much, there must be at least one Great Person among them.
*This tribe specialised in rearing silk worms, but their trade was limited in scope and they could not survive an incursion with Mongolian culture*[NEWLINE]You once weaved fine Silks and lived peaceful, fulfilling lives. You can again! If you serve under the Great Khan, he will see that you flourish.
*Another people devastated by contact with the Horde. We cannot rule over destroyed lands*[NEWLINE]Guard, fetch me the Economic Advisor. We must do something about this predicament immediately.
*This tribe grew Tea unlike those seen anywhere in the world*[NEWLINE]Far across the sea of grass there are Cities of people who would kill for this Tea you have cultivated all your days. If you serve under the Khan, he will allow you to bring it to them, and prosper.
*The holy men we once allowed to regroup have established a respected and peaceful community. They beg for these mens' lives*[NEWLINE]Where the wildfire destroys, the growth is strongest. We shall of course honour the wishes of our wisest sages; these men will live to build great Monasteries for their saviours.
*This small band of raiders was captured dynamiting an old quarry, it seems there are rumours of more to be found*[NEWLINE]Get my Scientific Advisor in here. I wonder if there is any truth to these rumours? This land bred a harsh people, perhaps it held more for us than we knew.
